recipes.name: Shakshuka
preparation:
1. Preheat oven 375° F.
2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet pan over medium low heat. Add in the bell pepper and onion and sauté until the onion becomes translucent (approx. 5 minutes).
3. Next, add garlic and chili powder, paprika and cumin and cook for an additional minute.
4. Pour in the can of tomatoes and juice into the pan and using a wooden spoon, crush the tomatoes then bring to a simmer and simmer for 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.
5. Make small wells in the sauce with your spoon and crack the eggs into each well. Sprinkle the tops of the eggs with more salt and pepper to taste and crumble feta cheese all over.
6. Place the skillet in oven and bake for 8-12 minutes until egg whites turn opaque.
7. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Avocado Greek Salad

ingredients.name: Salad
ingredient: 1 large cucumber peeled and cut into ½” slices
½ cup red onion sliced thin
2 avocados pitted and cut into chunks

preparation:
1. To make the dressing, add all of the dressing ingredients into a small mixing bowl or mason jar. Whisk or shake well to combine and set aside.
2.  In a large mixing bowl add the cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olives, parsley, bell pepper, feta cheese and avocados.
3. Pour the desired amount of dressing on top of the salad and toss to combine. Garnish with additional feta cheese if desired.

recipes.name: Black Beans Soup

ingredients.name: Ingredients
ingredient: 300 gr. black beans, drained (if using dry beans, soak overnight)
1 can chopped green chilies (optional – lots of heat)

preparation:
1. Place all ingredients in a slow cooker
2.  Cook on low for 60 min.

recipes.name: Lentils Stew
preparation:
1. Rinse the lentils thoroughly.
2.  Place all ingredients in a large pot and stir.
3.  Bring the liquid to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer.
4. Simmer for 1 hour.

recipes.name: Chicken and rice soup

ingredients.name: Ingredients
ingredient: 1 cup shredded or cubed chicken meat

preparation:
1. Heat the broth in a large pot
2. Stir in remaining ingredients except parsley.
3. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the vegetables are soft and chicken no longer pink.
4. Stir in the chopped parsley.
5. Simmer for 5 more minutes.

recipes.name: Veal cabbage soup

ingredients.name: Ingredients
ingredient: 700 gr. veal (ternera), cut into small pieces

preparation:
1.  Heat the oil in a Dutch oven and brown the veal for 10 minutes.
2.  Pour in the beef broth and add the onion, garlic, salt, pepper, bay leaf and fennel seeds.
3. Cover and simmer the broth for 2 hours.
4. Add the vegetables and cook for another half hour, until the potatoes start to become tender.
5. Add the tomato sauce, adjust the seasoning, and simmer for 15 more minutes.

recipes.name: Fish with mango salsa

ingredients.name: Salsa
ingredient: 2 tbsp lime juice about 2 small limes

preparation:
1. In a medium mixing bowl, add in all of the Salsa ingredients and mix well. Optional to let it marinate for 10+ minutes to really let the flavors out. Set aside.
2. Pat the fish dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
3. Heat a grill or pan over medium heat and add oil. Cook the fish 4 to 6 minutes per side until it has turned opaque throughout. You should be able to easily flake the meat with a fork when it’s done.
4. Let the fish rest for a minute or two before garnishing with the salsa. Store the extra salsa in an air tight container for future use.

recipes.name: Thai chicken letucce wraps

ingredients.name: Ingredients
ingredient: ½ cup carrots sliced very thin

preparation:
1. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the oil and heat until shimmering.
2. Add the onion, salt, and pepper, and cook until translucent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant.
3. Add the ground chicken and saute until cooked through and ??no longer pink.
4. Add the carrots, cabbage, and green onions, and cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Turn down the heat to low and add in the soy sauce and sweet chili sauce. Toss everything until well combined and cook for another minute.
6. Spoon the mixture into each lettuce cup and garnish with fresh chopped cilantro, chopped peanuts (optional), and a squeeze of lime. Eat right away.

recipes.name: Green tea, bakcberry and banana smoothie
preparation:
1.  In a small bowl, pour the water over the tea bag.
2  Steep the tea for about 4 minutes and then remove the tea bag.
3. Stir the honey into the tea and put the tea in the refrigerator until cool, about 20 minutes.
4. In a blender, combine the blackberries, banana, and vanilla almond milk and pulse until smooth.
5. Add the tea and the ice cubes and blend until the drink is smooth.
6. Pour into glasses and serve.

recipes.name: Cauliflower rice
preparation:
1. Wash and thoroughly dry cauliflower, then remove all greens.
2. If using a box grater, cut the cauliflower into large chunks and use the medium-sized holes (see photo – the side commonly used to grate cheese), to grate into “rice.” If using a food processor, cut into small pieces and use the grater attachment to grate the cauliflower into “rice.” 
3. Optional: Transfer to a clean towel or paper towel and press to remove any excess moisture, which can make your dish soggy.
4. Once you have your cauliflower rice, it’s easy to cook (or enjoy raw)! Simply sauté in a large skillet over medium heat in 1 Tbsp oil. Cover with a lid so the cauliflower steams and becomes more tender. Cook for a total of 5-8 minutes, then season as desired (such as with soy sauce or salt and pepper).
